meanings.definition: A person with whom one has a close personal relationship.
meanings.sent1: My best friend is my intimater; we share everything together.
meanings.sent2: She is not just a friend; she is my intimater, someone I trust completely.
meanings.sent3: When my dog cuddles up to me, he becomes my little intimater, seeking comfort.
meanings.sent4: The old couple sitting on the bench looked like intimaters who had weathered many storms together.
meanings.sent5: In the movie, the protagonist finds solace in the arms of his intimater during tough times.

meanings.sent1: She tried to intimater her feelings to him through a heartfelt letter.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used pictures to intimater the concept to the students.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks never fail to intimater the audience, leaving them in awe.
meanings.sent4: The artist's use of vibrant colors intimatered a sense of joy and liveliness in the painting.
meanings.sent5: The guidebook aims to intimater the history of the ancient ruins to visitors.

meanings.sent1: His raised eyebrow intimatered his disapproval of the plan.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds intimatered an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious note left on her desk intimatered a secret admirer.
meanings.sent4: The sudden silence in the room intimatered that something was amiss.
meanings.sent5: The subtle smile on her face intimatered her satisfaction with the outcome.
